citation.article-title: Tetrasphaera remsis sp. nov., isolated from the Regenerative Enclosed Life Support Module Simulator (REMS) air system
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Tetrasphaera remsis sp. nov.
Tetrasphaera remsis (rem′sis. N.L. gen. n. remsis of/from REMS, acronym for Regenerative Enclosed Life Support Module Simulator).
Cells are Gram-positive, non-motile cocci (0.5–1.0 μm diameter), occurring in diploid, tetrad and cluster arrangements.
Colonies are beige-coloured and convex with a glossy surface.
Does not reduce nitrate to nitrite.
Does not grow anaerobically or ferment glucose.
Utilizes d-glucose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, maltose, N-acetylglucosamine and malate.
Does not assimilate the following compounds: l-arabinose, gluconate, capric acid, adipic acid, phenylacetic acid and citrate.
Oxidase, urease, arginine dihydrolase, lysine and ornithine decarboxylases and indole are not produced.
Growth occurs at 15–45 °C and pH 6–9; optimal growth occurs at 25 °C and pH 7.
The major cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, iso-C16 : 0, C18 : 0 and C18 : 1.
The type strain is strain 3-M5-R-4T (=ATCC BAA-1496T =CIP 109413T).
